alert.note: Alert for Northern Franklin; Northern Oxford; Southern Franklin; Southern Oxford; Southern Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 04 at 3:26AM EST until January 05 at 12:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...WINTRY PRECIPITATION TO MAKE FOR SLIPPERY TRAVEL TONIGHT AND THURSDAY... .Low pressure will move south of New England later today and tonight. It will initially start as rain except for in the mountains where snow and sleet is likely with some freezing rain possible. Eventually colder air works southward across the entire region tonight changing the precipitation to a mix of light snow, sleet, and freezing rain which should continue through at least Thursday morning allowing for slippery travel. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON EST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow and sleet accumulations up to 3 inches and ice accumulations around one tenth of an inch. * WHERE...Portions of south central and western Maine. Portions of northern New Hampshire. * WHEN...From 7 PM this evening to Noon EST Thursday. * IMPACTS...A period of mixed precipitation is expected today at high elevations with air temperatures remaining below freezing. A mixture of snow and sleet is then expected tonight. Expect slippery road conditions and avoid travel if possible. Even light snowfall amounts can accumulate on roads and cause dangerous driving conditions due to snow covered roads. The hazardous conditions will impact the Thursday morning commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org
